entry.title: Newsletter #126
entry.content:
TechThursday is here!

We are featuring a T-shirt clash after more than a year, this time it is Shidhin and Geshan but different colors:)

We would also like to welcome back Shidhin from his vacation. And here is your weekly quota of some interesting links

Enjoy!

  • 8 ways to become a better coder

  • [1602.07168] zerodb white paper

  • blob storage: how i used it to host my podcast mp3 files | noupe

  • design’s fully-baked deliverables and half-baked artifacts — ux immersion: interactions — medium

  • docker, alpine, garbage and you – mrjoy

  • dockerize your development workstation

  • don’t let chatops become chatoops – michael ansel

  • finding memory leaks in go programs

  • go object oriented design

  • how to fix the go package management problem

  • issue and pull request templates

  • leveling up your javascript – telerik developer network

  • logging v. instrumentation

  • new in symfony 2.8: clock mocking and time sensitive tests (symfony blog)

  • no cart left behind

  • playtime is over: investors want their money back

  • the $300 million button ux articles by uie

  • understanding git for real by exploring the .git directory — medium

entry.title: Newsletter #116
entry.content:
Hi folks!

Yet another photo of Alex, Cirpo and Oba from DockerCon Europe 2015.

Also, we celebrated Prabeesh’s birthday by giving Lucio as a birthday present; not sure if he liked it but he seemed happy.

Below you can find the usual list of interesting articles we discovered in the past 7 days.

  • 8 tips about overcoming impostor syndrom

  • a quick guide to peer code review (and why you should do it)

  • after docker: unikernels and immutable infrastructure

  • chatting about chatops from atlassian summit – atlassian developers

  • dance to calypso – wordpress -php +react/nodejs

  • deploying with git-flow, tags and circleci

  • javascript swap in-place array elements

  • magento/magento2

  • one-click deploy for service oriented architectures – kate heddleston (software engineer) – youtube

  • pinboard tips for web design

  • random writings and thoughts about python: openbsd support for psutil

  • react-starter for beginners

  • simple o(n2) sorting algorithms in javascript

  • software and entrepreneurship with seth godin – software engineering daily

  • support for older versions of internet explorer ends on january 12, 2016

  • the craft of collaboration

entry.title: Newsletter #115
entry.content:
Hi folks!

Alex and Oba are back from DockerCon Europe 2015. Looks like Oba and Cirpo had fun at DockerCon.

Below you can find the usual list of interesting articles we discovered in the past 7 days.

  • 7 essential slack integrations developers should know | takipi blog

  • a new era of commerce innovation | magento

  • coreos introduces clair: open source vulnerability analysis for your containers

  • creating a fake api with hapi for your client-side application – node.js video tutorial

  • deploy and manage any cluster manager with docker swarm

  • dockercon eu 2015: docker trusted registry 1.4 with integrated content trust and universal control plane

  • fsto: re-evaluating front-end peformance best practices // speaker deck

  • hey isis! check out how ‘idiot’ anonymous hackers can disrupt your online propaganda – the hacker news

  • jcuga/golongpoll

  • jessie frazelle’s blog: docker containers on the desktop

  • nature/shunter

  • node.js at netflix with yunong xiao | software engineering daily

  • on currying and partial function application

  • phpspec & behat: two testing tools that write code for you

  • progressive web apps: escaping tabs without losing our soul – infrequently noted

  • react at facebook with ben alpert – software engineering daily

  • redux – predictable state container for javascript apps

  • server-side rendering with redux and react-router | codementor

  • six years of go

  • software engineer traits — engineering leadership — medium

  • source code poetry

  • the offline cookbook – jakearchibald.com

  • the origin of the 8-hour work day and why we should rethink it

  • unicorns dropping like flies: first dropbox; then square; now fidelity cuts snapchat valuation by 25%

  • what the web platform can learn from node.js – atlassian developers

  • zero notifications

entry.title: Newsletter #101
entry.content:
Hi guys, even after the 100th newsletter we still have something to suggest you.

This week Cirpo, David and Alex went to the warehouse … it seems Namshi Tech will release a new application soon.

Here the links, enjoy:
